title: Calories in Fudge
meta_description: Discover calories in fudge per 100g serving, including carbs, sugars, fat, protein, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Chocolate fudge, standard homemade recipe; dense, creamy texture without nuts or add-ins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, flavor, and portion size; homemade vs. store-bought can differ significantly. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Fudge contains about 410 kcal per 100g, primarily from sugars and fats.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

faqs.q: How many calories in one piece of fudge?
faqs.a: Typically 50-100 kcal per small piece (15-25g), depending on size.
Yes, about 65g sugars per 100g, making it a treat to enjoy in moderation.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in fudge?
faqs.a: Around 14g total fat per 100g, with 9g saturated from butter and chocolate.
Minimal, only about 3g per 100g; not a significant source.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in fudge?
faqs.a: Opt for dark chocolate, reduce sugar, or add fiber-rich ingredients like cocoa powder.
